name: CET-6 Core Vocabulary
description: Essential vocabulary for CET-6 exam preparation.

sentences: You must abide by the rules of the school.
I cannot abide his arrogant attitude.
The test results showed abnormal cell growth.
Such cold weather is abnormal for July.
The government plans to abolish the outdated tax.
Slavery was abolished in the 19th century.
The meeting came to an abrupt end.
His abrupt manner made everyone uncomfortable.
It is absurd to believe that the earth is flat.
The whole situation was completely absurd.
There is an abundance of fresh fruit in summer.
The region is famous for its abundance of wildlife.
She bought a matching handbag as an accessory.
He was charged as an accessory to the crime.
His actions are in accord with his words.
She was accorded a warm welcome.
He acknowledged his mistake publicly.
I must acknowledge the help of my colleagues.
Language acquisition is easier for children.
The company announced a major acquisition.
Press the button to activate the alarm.
The drug activates the immune system.

words.chinese: adj. 敏锐的，剧烈的；急性的
sentences: Dogs have an acute sense of smell.
The patient is suffering from acute pain.
The stamp adheres firmly to the envelope.
We must adhere to the principles of fairness.
Our house is adjacent to the park.
The fire quickly spread to adjacent buildings.
It takes skill to administer a large company.
The nurse will administer the vaccine.
Adolescents often face peer pressure.
She is going through an adolescent phase.
The drug has no adverse side effects.
They sailed in adverse weather conditions.

words.chinese: adj./n. 空中的，航空的；天线
sentences: They conducted an aerial survey of the area.
The TV aerial was damaged in the storm.
The building has great aesthetic value.
The design is pleasing from an aesthetic point of view.

words.chinese: v./n. 使隶属，加入；附属机构
sentences: The college is affiliated with the university.
The company has many affiliates overseas.
The witness affirmed that he saw the defendant.
The court affirmed the lower court's ruling.
His comments only aggravated the situation.
The pollution aggravates her asthma.
The aggregate of all donations was impressive.
These small gains aggregate into a significant advantage.
He was in agony after the accident.
She went through agony waiting for the results.

words.chinese: adj./v./n. 警觉的；使警惕；警报
sentences: The guard remained alert throughout the night.
The sign alerts drivers to the sharp turn ahead.

words.chinese: adj./n. 外国的，陌生的；外国人，外星人
sentences: The customs seemed alien to the new immigrants.
The movie is about an alien invasion.
The report alleges corruption in the department.
He is alleged to have stolen the money.
The medicine helps alleviate the pain.
Measures were taken to alleviate poverty.
The government will allocate funds for the project.
We need to allocate resources efficiently.

words.chinese: v./adj. 交替，轮流；间隔的，轮流的
sentences: Day alternates with night.
The group meets on alternate Thursdays.

words.chinese: adj. 模棱两可的，不明确的
sentences: His answer was deliberately ambiguous.
The law is ambiguous on this issue.
